turns.therapist: Hello, I'm glad you're here today. How are you feeling?
turns.patient: *sigh* I don't know...I'm just really mad all the time. Like, everything makes me angry. Why can't adults just listen to me? I'm tired of feeling like I'm not being heard.

turns.therapist: Can you tell me more about what makes you feel angry? Like, can you give me an example of something that happened recently that made you feel that way?
turns.patient: *sigh* Yeah, like yesterday. My mom told me I couldn't have a sleepover with my friends because it was a school night. And she just wouldn't listen to me when I tried to explain why it was important. I felt so mad and resentful. I just wanted to scream at her.

turns.therapist: *empathetic* Oh, I can imagine how frustrating that must have been for you. It sounds like you felt really misunderstood and disrespected. Can you tell me more about how you usually handle situations like that? Do you have any strategies for calming down or expressing your feelings in a more constructive way?
turns.patient: *moody* *sigh* I don't know...I just get angry and yell sometimes. Or I just storm off and do my own thing. I don't know what else to do. It feels like no one ever listens to me.

turns.therapist: *empathetic* I see. It sounds like you're feeling pretty overwhelmed and frustrated with the situation. It's understandable to feel that way when you don't feel like your feelings are being heard or respected. Can you tell me more about what you're hoping to get out of our sessions together? Is there anything you want to work on or explore?
turns.patient: *resistant* *sigh* I don't know...I just don't want to feel this way all the time. I want to be able to express myself without getting yelled at or ignored. Can you help me with that?

turns.therapist: *empathetic* Of course, I'm here to help you work through these feelings and find ways to communicate your emotions in a more constructive way. It's important to remember that you have the right to express your feelings and have them heard and respected. Let's work together to find some strategies that can help you feel more confident and heard in your interactions with others. How does that sound?

*empathetic* It's okay, take your time. It can be really tough to talk about these kinds of feelings, especially when they're related to situations that are still happening in your life. Can you tell me more about what you're hoping to get out of our sessions together? Is there anything you want to work on or explore?
turns.patient: *resistant* *sigh* I don't know...I just don't want to feel this way all the time. Is there anything you can do to help me?
